Announcing... the Badger Badger Badger Tour! JeffWaugh will be travelling for a month and a half, criss-crossing the northern hemisphere, to bring the world of Ubuntu to your doorstep. Expect <nowiki>[[http://www.badgerbadgerbadger.com/|badgers]]</nowiki>, mushrooms, schnaaaaaakes, an awful lot of Ubuntu CDs, and a healthy dose of madcap hijinks. If you'd like to catch up with Jeff during the tour, add your details to this page or <nowiki>[[mailto:jeff.waugh@ubuntu.com|send him an email]]</nowiki>!

''Each section includes a list of people or groups I'll be catching up with. I will try to include contact details where possible, so anyone checking out this page can join in. Please email me if you would like contact details for a particular item.''

== Major Cities Tour ==

The following groups around the USA (and Canada!) have managed to rearrange my schedule through petition power! I'll be visiting all of them on my way from Canada to Mexico. Come along if you're nearby!

=== Toronto, Canada: November 7th ===

* <nowiki>[[http://mces.blogspot.com/2005/09/torontonians-we-need-your-help.html|Toronto]]</nowiki> Ubuntu lovers, including TLUG and <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntutoronto.org/|Ubuntu Toronto]]</nowiki> LoCo team!

=== Washington DC, November 8th ===

* <nowiki>[[http://novalug.tux.org/|NoVALUG]]</nowiki> in Washington DC and Northern Virginia

=== Princeton, November 9th ===

* <nowiki>[[http://www.lugip.org/|LUG/IP]]</nowiki> and other groups in New Jersey!

=== Raleigh/Durham, November 10th ===

* <nowiki>[[http://www.trilug.org/|TriLUG]]</nowiki> and nearby groups in North Carolina... at their meeting location: Red Hat World Headquarters!
